ticket.title: rdoc mentions inexistent "collection.exist?" method (should be "exists?")
ticket.original-body:
Many areas of the inline docs for associations talk about a `collection.exist?` method, but it's actually called `exists?`, like in `ActiveRecord::Base.exists?`.
Here's a patch for the mentions I found.
ticket.latest-body:
Many areas of the inline docs for associations talk about a `collection.exist?` method, but it's actually called `exists?`, like in `ActiveRecord::Base.exists?`.
Here's a patch for the mentions I found.
ticket.original-body-html:
Many areas of the inline docs for associations talk about a collection.exist? method, but it's actually called exists?, like in ActiveRecord::Base.exists?.

Here's a patch for the mentions I found.

version.body:
Many areas of the docs for associations talk about a `collection.exist?` method, but it's actually called `exists?`, as a parallel for `ActiveRecord::Base.exists?`.
Here's a patch for the mentions I found.
version.body-html:
Many areas of the docs for associations talk about a collection.exist? method, but it's actually called exists?, as a parallel for ActiveRecord::Base.exists?.

Here's a patch for the mentions I found.
version.title: [PATCH] rdoc mentions inexistent "collection.exist?" method (should be "exists?")

version.body: Hi, we're handling documentation patches via [docrails](http://github.com/lifo/docrails/tree/master). If you stick your github user name in a comment here lifo can give you access to it
version.body-html: Hi, we're handling documentation patches via docrails. If you stick your github user name in a comment here lifo can give you access to it
version.title: [PATCH] rdoc mentions inexistent "collection.exist?" method (should be "exists?")

version.body:
I've added 'mernen' to docrails. If you're GH username is different, please comment it here :)
Thanks.
version.body-html:
I've added 'mernen' to docrails. If you're GH username is different, please comment it here :)

Thanks.
